metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48279 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ModSecurity before 2.9.6 and 3.x before 3.0.8, HTTP multipart requests were incorrectly parsed and could bypass the Web Application Firewall. NOTE: this is related to CVE-2022-39956 but can be considered independent changes to the ModSecurity (C language) codebase.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48279` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmodsecurity3 - 3.0.8-1
No subscription required

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.9.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: modsecurity package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-1').
modsecurity-apache package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7-1').
